intro: Pimpinella huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén's cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its slender stems and small white or yellowish flowers are characteristic of the genus Pimpinella. The leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance and ecological role in its environment.
